main.name: Anil Ghimire
main.description: I'm Full Stack Web developer and I mainly use the MERN stack
main.bio: I love design and innovation of products that makes peoples life convenient. From my early childhood, I was fascinated by the working mechanism and innovation of technologies like car, airplane and cell phone. Since then, I wanted to be someone who works for the design and innovation of such products. It seemed like an appropriate dream given that I graduated with BE in Mechanical Engineering. I gravitated towards the design, innovation and improvements of products for the welfare of society. I got chance to work on a project with Department of Sanitation New York(DSNY) for the design improvement of trucks interior. Apart from the experience in Engineering, I yearned to learn more, yearned to learn something related to programming to compete in the era of computer technologies. That’s when it happened; the spark got ignited at the instant I learned my first Java tutorial video. Since then, I can’t get enough of learning programming languages. I learnt HTML,CSS, JavaScript and Linux. Web development at all calls to my passion as it incorporates my creativity and problem-solving skills and moreover I’m allowed to break to improve the code. I love applying different design principles and watch my web pages shrink into different devices. I was oddly satisfied when I published my first web page, but I still keep my creativity flash intact. My specialties include problem solving, responsive design principles, result oriented and quickly learning new skills and programming language. Till now, I have learnt C++, MATLAB, Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Linux and AWS. I have started learning Python and SQL. I’m enthusiastically learning other programming languages and principles that I can incorporate in future.

Awarded Dean’s list for Spring 2016, Fall 2016, Spring 2017, Fall 2017 and Recipient of LaGuardia Foundation Scholarship, 2016-2017

work.title: Full Stack Web Developer Intern
work.description: Developed a mobile app known as “Nudge”, which is particularly dedicated for the alumni network and designed for professional career advisement; it authenticates users based on colleges and grants them access to video conferencing, meetings scheduler, and sending texts

work.title: Engineering Intern
work.description: Led a team of 5 to design and fabricate a storage box for collector trucks for DSNY using SolidWorks and Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and examined the obtained results from SolidWorks using MATLAB for prototype manufacturing
